page.description: Fires when the user tries to undo edits to the List Detail View form. If function returns false, action is cancelled.

section.description: When you create a List Control Detail View you can add a number of pre-defined buttons to the UX component that will automatically work with the Detail View and also Synchronize the Detail View with the List Control. The 'Undo', aka 'Reset', button is one of these defined controls.

Adding a canUndoEdits event definition allows users to cancel the undo. By default, the built in dialog below will appear in the application when you define code for this event. For example, if an alert such as alert("Warning"); is defined for the canUndoEdits Event, then in Live Preview this alert will fire first and be followed by this:

section.title: Adding an Undo Button
section.description: To add an Undo button, click on the "List-Detail View-Buttons" option in the Defined Controls section of the UX Controls page. Highlight the list that the Detail View buttons apply to, and check the "Undo edits to Detail View (before edits are saved)" option.

step.description: Open the Defined Controls menu and select "List-Detail View-Buttons"
Select a list and the "Undo edits to Detail View (before edits are saved)" option.
